column4: hey everybody this is my pastebin url http://paste.ubuntu.com/57097/
are you installing to a server edition or a GUI one?
have you tried it without the purge command?
run this command and let me know what shows up "ps -A | grep mysql"
ok, mysql is still up and running. lets try stopping it manually, run "/etc/init.d/mysql stop"
seems like it doesn't want to go down, is it being used right now?
try it and then do the "ps -A | grep mysql"
if that doesn't take it down i am out of ideas for stopping it other then a kill with the PID number (which the ps command gives you). but you should stop it first then try removing it
ok try to remove it now
synaptic is GUI, so just do the apt-get, run the same command you tried before
i got to go, if you have any more problems i am sure one of the other guys in here will be happy to help you. good luck
i am not sure. never tried to removed mysql. i have to get going, so many one of the other guys and answer that question or even google might be able too
